newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - Dec 23.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
The government on Sunday constituted an inquiry commission to investigate into the jail revolt in Jessore.
The government will hold the second round of international conference on prospect of hydrocarbon exploration in Bangladesh in February. World Bank will sponsor the conferences in London and Houston.
The second conference of the chief justices of the SAARC countries will begin on Dcember 28 in Bangladesh.
Opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) has criticised the government for resorting to force in ending the revolt in Jessore jail.
The government has offered tribal insurgent leader Jyotirindra Budhipriya Larma medicare in Dhaka. Larma is suffering from malaria fever.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said on Sunday her government would implement specific programmes to ensure welfare of the freedom fighters and establish their dignity in society.

A guideline on share price movement, finalised by a special committee on Sunday, may allow adjustment of prices after corporate actions but is unlilkely to widen the existing five percent range of price fluctuation.
